title: Status of hosts
author: spisarau
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
When I click host name I can see status button. 
## Expected Behavior
Is it possible to to check check status of all host in expanded folder and change indication of host depending on accessible  host or not.



## Context
It would be great to see all active and inactive hosts in current expanded directory.


## Your Environment
* Version used: ALL
* Operating System and version (e.g. Windows 10 1709 x64):

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
That's probably a bad idea to implement. Maybe as a optional feature but even then I'm pretty sceptical.
At least this should never be a default. Since we're detecting the host status by it's response to a ping we would need to permanently ping every single host to have a reliable indication.
This could be a neat gimmick for people with ~20 connections but for everyone else with a big list of hosts this is nothing but redundant network traffic.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Feature request to display online/offline status of hosts in the connection tree, a commonly requested enhancement for remote connection managers.
Approach: Add background ping/port-check worker that periodically probes hosts and updates a status icon on each connection node in the tree view.
